Low-Spec mode pretty much nixes all of the champ select animations that cause lag. We are thinking about ways we can improve it further but a lot of the more recent general performance fixes (that work for everybody and not just those using low spec mode) have had a really big impact. How's it working out for you on the latest patch?

If you're having trouble with champ select it really wouldn't hurt to try out low-spec mode, no matter what kind of machine you have. All it does is turn off animations and unnecessary visual effects.

TBH we probably should have named it "No Frills Mode" so people don't feel weird about using it.

Will it be easier to write Notes for friends in the Beta Client?

Legacy Client: https://www.hiveworkshop.com/attachments/legacyclientexample-png.266272/
Beta Client: https://www.hiveworkshop.com/attachments/betaclientexample-png.266271/
~~I lost my picture of the Legacy Client note writing system~~ EDIT nevermind found it, but basically, in the Legacy Client I could read basically the entire Note while editing it because it allowed me to see multiple lines of text. In the Beta Client there is only one line, so I need to do a lot of side scrolling if I need to edit a finished note, which is annoying.

The current system for writing notes is workable but a bit frustrating. Could you this get changed?
---
EDIT: Hijacking my own post to remind everyone to support their region by buying the 1 IP icon and wearing it in matches!
We don't have plans right now but can look into it.  What type of information do you like to put in a note? Maybe we can think of other solutions that better give you the info you want too :)

> [{quoted}](name=ChocChipCookie,realm=NA,application-id=Ag8jgd8Q,discussion-id=rN1Ezrbe,comment-id=000000080000,timestamp=2017-04-24T20:23:19.678+0000)
>
> We don't have plans right now but can look into it.  What type of information do you like to put in a note? Maybe we can think of other solutions that better give you the info you want too :)

Hi, thanks for the prompt response! I like to put how I met a friend (for example, if it was via a game, then I'll put my score and my Champion so that I can quickly find the match via Match History), what the friend likes to do, the friend's name if I know him or her in real life, and the friend's old Summoner Name if the friend changes his or her name to something else. I don't edit the notes frequently but sometimes something just comes up that I feel like I should note down, then I will do that. The Legacy Client made it easier than the Beta Client to do editing.
I like writing Notes so that if the person changes his or her name I'll still know who he or she is, and if I leave League and come back, I will still know who all my friends are. In the unfortunate situation where I forget a friend, I can always just refer back to my handy notes and say "oh right, that was the game where we met, now it's coming back to me, this guy really likes X Champions and is a generally pretty friendly person."
This is cool insight and some stuff we've talked about showing for you (like when a name changes) down the line.  Thanks for sharing.  We'll look into how the text box expands as well :)
This is already a feature. Right click your friend and select "edit note".

> [{quoted}](name=diverdownbl,realm=NA,application-id=Ag8jgd8Q,discussion-id=rN1Ezrbe,comment-id=00000008000000000000,timestamp=2017-04-24T20:30:59.742+0000)
>
> This is already a feature. Right click your friend and select "edit note".

I know it's already a feature. I provided the information above because ChocChipCookie asked me what I used the Note feature for.

I would like an easier to use interface for the editing of Notes on the Beta Client. Right now it is one line and I can't see the entire note when I edit it, which is mildly frustrating.

Why does almost everything take more clicks? Even scrolling the chat requires more effort. It's not a huge deal but the interface seems extremely inefficient from a UI standpoint. 

I also miss the option to minimize the friends list. There's no reason to always have it open and it's pretty annoying on smaller screens.

Finally, while I'm very happy to have replays, it would be nice to be able to put my favorite replays into a sort of vault which won't obsolete them with future versions of the game. I'm not sure on the technical feasibility of doing so though.

When will the stat info be fixed for champion ability details (e.g. range, AD/AP ratios, cost, base damage, etc.)?

It's cut out for now because we realized that a problem with the actual game file system was making the information incorrect. We'll update you as soon as we know more but I think they might not come back for a while. Sorry to be the bearer of bad news :/

The social panel permanently being there is a design choice we made for the sake of future functionality we're going to add in. It already has the ability to hold additional info like your time in queue, game invites, and club information (whereas before all of those things were relegated to individual little tabs and popups). So, later on, we'll likely use the space for other things as well so it feels more valuable to you.

Also, unlike in the old client, there's nothing hiding behind the social panel—every screen was designed to fit alongside it, to leverage more information we plan to display. We couldn't just minimize it without a bunch of other stuff breaking, so this isn't a change we're planning on making to be super straight with ya.

What exactly are you looking to expand here?

In my opinion, this particular "chat" UI doesnt look very good, and it feels very cluttered and filled with information. 
If you add EVEN more stuff, I fear that it will become too much.

I'll trust you guys to come through strong though!
